greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rebase n from 3 to 2. Replace 3^k with 2^k in ternary expansion of n.
comment: Fixed point of the morphism 0->0,1,2; 1->2,3,4; 2->4,5,6; ...; n->2n,2n+1,2n+2. - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 22 2011
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
program: (PARI) Rebase(x, b, c)= { local(d, e=0, f=1); while (x>0, d=x-b*(x\b); x\=b; e+=d*f; f*=c); return(e) } { for (n=0, 1000, write("b065361.txt", n, " ", Rebase(n, 3, 2)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Oct 17 2009
r end; [a(n) for n in 0:76] |> println # _Peter Luschny_, Jan 03 2021
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, Oct 31 2001
